fields.headline: Idaten denied by ill wind
fields.bodyText: Massive windshifts towards the end of their race with the new Swedish boat Orn made a mockery of an otherwise excellent performance by the British challenge in the America's Cup International Regatta on Hauraki Gulf. The British boat Idaten, skippered by Ian Walker, had led for the first round of the two-lap course only to watch helplessly when the wind backed through 120 degrees, giving Orn the advantage it needed to take control The Swedish boat claimed victory by 58 seconds over Idaten, which with Andy Beadsworth steering and Walker, together with Adrian Stead, calling the strategic decisions had led by 32 seconds at one stage. In the other match Team New Zealand, skippered by Dean Barker, beat America's One World by more than two minutes. · You've read the piece, now have your say.
